settings.headline_text: Spinning? Mental Chatter? We got you.

settings.body_text:
Is the to-do list in your head never off and never done? De-clutter your mind and calm your body with herbs that let you feel like you.

Women are taught to worry with the idea it helps us do better. Let go of the chatter and find peace whenever needed.

settings.quote: Exactly what I needed… they should give you a bag full of these when you usign up to run a non-profit.
settings.author: Heyhannahd

settings.list_text: Un-Worry can be taken at multiple points of the day or night.
Try it before a high-nerves situation like a presentation.
Try it on your nightstand. Take 2 full droppers when you can’t fall or stay asleep.

settings.title: What's a tincture?
settings.summary: Tinctures are highly concentrated herbal formulas in liquid form. You can drink or "dropper" them directly into your mouth to get the benefits of the active ingredients even faster than a capsule, gummy or candle as they do not need to be broken down in your stomach. They go directly into your system, particularly if you squirt them under your tongue.

settings.title: Can I use the Un-Worry Tincture every day?
settings.summary: Yes. Our formulas are made up of all natural ingredients and can be used for daily support.

settings.title: Can I use Un-Worry Tincture with other medication?
settings.summary: Our products are all-natural and can be used in conjunction with other Wile products. Please speak to your primary physician before taking Un-Worry Tincture with other medications.

settings.title: Can I use Un-Worry with the other tinctures or products?
settings.summary: Absolutely. Our product line is designed to mix and match. You can take more than 1 type of tincture in the same day, or pair it with our capsules or drinks.

settings.title: How do I use Un-Worry?
settings.summary: This is an herbal tincture with a dropper inside. Use a full dropper (or 2) directly into your mouth, under your tongue or on it. Some people prefer to add the tincture to water or tea.

settings.title: Are there clincial studies supporting Un-Worry Tincture?
settings.summary:
Ingredient studies include:

Calabrese C, Gregory WL, Leo M, Kraemer D, Bone K, Oken B. Effects of a standardized Bacopa monnieri extract on cognitive performance, anxiety, and depression in the elderly: a randomized, double-blind, placebo-controlled trial. J Altern Complement Med.
2008;14(6):707-713.

Kongkeaw C, Dilokthornsakul P, Thanarangsarit P, Limpeanchob N, Norman Scholfield C. Meta-analysis of randomized controlled trials on cognitive effects of Bacopa monnieri extract. J Ethnopharmacol.
2014;151(1):528-535.

Jamshidi N, Cohen MM. The clinical efficacy and safety of tulsi in humans: a systematic review of the literature. Evid Based
Complement Alternat Med. 2017;2017:9217567.

Jothie Richard E, Illuri R, Bethapudi B, et al. Anti-stress activity of ocimum sanctum: possible effects on hypothalamic-pituitary-
adrenal axis. Phytother Res. 2016;30(5):805-814.

Janda K, Wojtkowska K, Jakubczyk K, Antoniewicz J, Skonieczna-
Żydecka K. Passiflora incarnata in neuropsychiatric disorders-a systematic review. Nutrients. 2020;12(12):E3894.

Tang W, Gao Y, Chen G, et al. A randomized, double-blind and placebo-controlled study of a Ganoderma lucidum polysaccharide
extract in neurasthenia. J Med Food. 2005;8(1):53-58.
